greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle, read by rows, where T(n,k) is the coefficient of q^(nk+k) in the squared q-factorial of n+1.
comment: Row sums equal A010790(n) = n!*(n+1)! for n>=0. Central terms form a bisection of A127728. Dual triangle is A129276.
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, q-Factorial from MathWorld.
example: faq(n,q) = Product_{k=1..n} (1-q^k)/(1-q) for n>0, with faq(0,q)=1.
Obtain row 3 from coefficients in the squared q-factorial of 4:
the resulting coefficients of q are:
where the terms enclosed in parenthesis form row 3.
xref: Cf. A129275 (column 1); A127728 (central terms), A010790 (row sums); related triangles: A129276, A128564, A008302 (Mahonian numbers).
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Apr 07 2007
